locations.name: Frogg Club
locations.description: Frogg Club is a popular nightclub, known for its electrifying atmosphere, top DJs, and vibrant dance floors that keep the party all night.

locations.name: Trucupey
locations.description: A go-to spot for lovers of Latin music, Trucupey Latin Disco features live performances, salsa dancing, and a high-energy crowd.

locations.name: La Troja
locations.description: La Troja is an iconic salsa club in Barranquilla, where locals and visitors come together to dance to traditional Caribbean rhythms.

locations.name: Museo del Caribe
locations.description: Museo del Caribe is a cultural landmark showcasing the rich history, art, and traditions of Colombia’s Caribbean region.

locations.name: Museo del Carnaval
locations.description: Museo del Carnaval is a must-visit for those interested in Barranquilla’s famous Carnival, featuring exhibits, costumes, and interactive displays.

locations.name: Teatro Amira de la Rosa
locations.description: Teatro Amira de la Rosa is Barranquilla’s historic theater, hosting performances ranging from classical music to contemporary plays.

locations.name: La Cueva
locations.description: La Cueva is a historic restaurant and bar that once hosted literary greats like Gabriel García Márquez, offering authentic Colombian cuisine and a nostalgic atmosphere.

locations.name: Varadero
locations.description: Varadero is a top-rated seafood restaurant in Barranquilla, known for its fresh ingredients and Cuban-inspired ambiance.

locations.name: El Celler
locations.description: A hidden gem offering gourmet international cuisine with a Colombian twist, El Celler is known for its elegant setting and exceptional service.

locations.name: Buenavista Mall
locations.description: Buenavista Mall is Barranquilla’s premier shopping destination, featuring high-end brands, a variety of restaurants, and an entertainment center.

locations.name: Portal del Prado
locations.description: A well-known shopping mall with a mix of local and international stores, Portal del Prado is a great spot for fashion, electronics, and dining.

locations.name: Artisanal Markets
locations.description: For a more local experience, the Calle 72 artisanal markets offer crafts, fresh produce, and traditional Colombian goods.

locations.name: Hotel El Prado
locations.description: Hotel El Prado is a historic landmark in Barranquilla, known for its grand architecture, luxurious accommodations, and storied past.

locations.name: Malecón del Río
locations.description: The Malecón del Río is a scenic boardwalk along the Magdalena River, offering a variety of dining options with stunning waterfront views.
